sources.title: Lists of languages
sources.progress: indexed via catalog_wikipedia_languages.py; needs continual refresh
sources.notes: Primary entry point for harvesting Wikipedia's grouped language, dialect, and accent lists. Drives the cached docs/wikipedia_language_index.* outputs that seed NVDA's tiered selector.

sources.title: List of ISO 639 language codes
sources.notes: Master table that links historic and modern ISO 639 identifiers; anchors phoneme profiles to authoritative code pairs for NVDA configuration exports.

sources.title: List of ISO 639-2 codes
sources.notes: Differentiates bibliographic (B) and terminologic (T) macrolanguage groupings required for backwards compatible voice template packaging.

sources.title: ISO 639 macrolanguage
sources.notes: Explains how multiple dialects and closely related languages collapse into a single ISO 639-3 code; informs dialect menu roll-ups.

sources.title: List of ISO 639-3 codes
sources.notes: Provides per-language scope (individual, macrolanguage, special) and type (living, extinct, historical) indicators for Eloquence voice catalog metadata.

sources.title: ISO 15924
sources.notes: Maps writing systems to four-letter codes; required for script-aware phoneme seed bundles and braille/export planning.

sources.title: List of scripts with no ISO 15924 code
sources.notes: Highlights gaps in ISO 15924 coverage so the phoneme customizer can stage provisional script identifiers and placeholder glyph datasets.

sources.title: ISO 15924: List of codes
sources.notes: Contains the canonical numeric and alphabetic script codes plus sample eras; feeds phoneme EQ defaults for script-specific consonant/vowel ranges.

sources.title: ConScript Unicode Registry
sources.notes: Documents community-maintained encoded scripts that inform fallback phoneme mappings when ISO standards do not exist.

sources.title: Medieval Unicode Font Initiative
sources.notes: Supplies historical glyph variants necessary for contextual phoneme shaping in medieval language templates.

sources.title: ISO 639-5
sources.notes: Defines alpha-3 codes for language families; sets up parent-level selectors and informs NVDA's mutually intelligible groupings.

sources.title: ISO 639-6
sources.notes: Captures dialect-level refinements formerly maintained in the 639-6 registry; helpful for accent-specific presets.

sources.title: List of ISO 639-6 codes
sources.notes: Archived table of ISO 639-6 identifiers that can seed dialect and accent menus where modern registries lack detail.

sources.title: Language family
sources.notes: Explains classification theory and relationships; guides the structuring of Eloquence's family-level overviews and documentation.

sources.title: IETF language tag
sources.notes: Details BCP 47 tags needed for NVDA configuration exports and bridging ISO codes with regional subtags (script, region, variant).

sources.title: Codes for constructed languages
sources.notes: Outlines how Esperanto, Interlingua, and other constructed languages receive standardized codes for packaging.

sources.title: Flag icons for languages
sources.notes: Offers accessible iconography references for NVDA dialogs while emphasising cultural sensitivity.

sources.title: Index of language articles
sources.notes: Master index for targeted research topics such as phonology, orthography, and sociolinguistics that influence phoneme EQ presets.

sources.title: List of lesser-known Loloish languages
sources.notes: Informs expansion of Sino-Tibetan coverage and highlights endangered dialects requiring urgent phoneme seeding.

sources.title: Hani languages
sources.notes: Details Hani/Miao-Yao dialect chains which align to phoneme contour variations documented in Loloish research.

sources.title: Taloid languages
sources.notes: Provides lexical comparison data for fine-tuning high-frequency consonant bands within Taloid dialect presets.

sources.title: Talodi–Heiban languages
sources.notes: Supports inclusion of Niger–Congo branches within African language packs.

sources.title: Yupik languages
sources.notes: Includes orthography and phoneme descriptions essential for polysynthetic language modelling.

sources.title: List of programming languages
sources.notes: Feeds pronunciation dictionaries for code reading modes; intersects with NVDA's developer audiences.

sources.title: List of BASIC dialects
sources.notes: Helps define accent/intonation cues for retro computing voices and developer-centric presets.

sources.title: List of constructed languages – Languages used in fiction
sources.notes: Guides fan-driven phoneme templates and ensures NVDA can surface fictional language presets with consistent metadata.

sources.title: List of official languages by country and territory
sources.notes: Supports priority planning for official support tiers and packaging by jurisdiction.

sources.title: List of countries by number of languages
sources.notes: Highlights multilingual hotspots to prioritise for phoneme and accent data collection.

sources.title: Lists of countries and territories by official language
sources.notes: Refines packaging needs for regional NVDA builds and cross-checks official statuses.

sources.title: Linguistic diversity index
sources.notes: Quantifies coverage gaps to measure Eloquence expansion impact regionally.

sources.title: List of language names
sources.notes: Assists with accessible naming and NVDA speech label localisation.

sources.title: Lists of extinct languages
sources.notes: Guides archival phoneme modelling and documentation of revived pronunciation efforts.

sources.title: List of language families
sources.notes: Provides enumerations of families for macro documentation and NVDA selector grouping.

sources.title: List of proposed language families
sources.notes: Tracks speculative relationships useful for research roadmaps and future-proofing dialect clustering.

sources.title: Extinct language
sources.notes: Offers guidance on documenting pronunciation evidence for languages without living speakers.

sources.title: Intercontinental Dictionary Series
sources.notes: Provides comparative lexicon samples necessary for cross-language phoneme and prosody tuning.

sources.title: International auxiliary language
sources.notes: Frames prioritisation for widely used constructed languages in accessibility contexts.

sources.title: Universal language
sources.notes: Historical background for universal speech projects; informs documentation narrative.

sources.title: Language isolate
sources.notes: Ensures isolates receive bespoke phoneme templates without incorrect family assignments.

sources.title: Unclassified language
sources.notes: Highlights research gaps for languages lacking classification; informs placeholder metadata.

sources.title: List of unclassified languages according to the Ethnologue
sources.notes: Adds Ethnologue perspective to unclassified languages, guiding outreach for phoneme data.

sources.title: Afroasiatic languages
sources.notes: Sets expectations for Semitic, Berber, Cushitic, Omotic, and Chadic coverage.

sources.title: List of Austronesian languages
sources.notes: Supports Pacific and Southeast Asian voice planning with sample lexical resources.

sources.title: List of Indo-European languages
sources.notes: Major coverage area for Eloquence; cross-links to existing NV Speech Player templates.

sources.title: List of Mayan languages
sources.notes: Provides glottalised consonant inventories needed for phoneme EQ presets.

sources.title: List of Mongolic languages
sources.notes: Informs vowel harmony parameter defaults for Mongolic voices.

sources.title: List of Oto-Manguean languages
sources.notes: Essential for building tonal contour presets for Mesoamerican languages.

sources.title: Tungusic languages: Classification
sources.notes: Guides template design for Siberian dialect clusters.

sources.title: List of Turkic languages
sources.notes: Supports vowel harmony and palatalization parameter sets.

sources.title: List of Uralic languages
sources.notes: Captures agglutinative morphology considerations for NVDA voice phrasing.

sources.title: List of languages by first written account
sources.notes: Contextualises script evolution timelines for historical voice packs.

sources.title: Undeciphered writing systems
sources.notes: Flags scripts that require placeholder phoneme strategies and research disclaimers.

sources.title: List of languages by total number of speakers
sources.notes: Guides prioritisation for voice and phoneme expansion.

sources.title: List of dictionaries by number of words
sources.notes: Identifies corpora suitable for training phoneme and prosody models.

sources.title: List of languages by number of phonemes
sources.notes: Directly informs EQ band planning and slider ranges for clarity vs. smoothness.

sources.title: Languages of Africa
sources.notes: Contextualises coverage targets for African voice bundles and sample rate needs for tonal languages.

sources.title: Indigenous languages of the Americas
sources.notes: Frames documentation for North, Central, and South American indigenous languages.

sources.title: List of Native American languages acquired by children
sources.notes: Identifies living acquisition contexts for tailoring phoneme instruction resources.

sources.title: Languages of North America
sources.notes: Feeds NVDA packaging notes for North American locales.

sources.title: Languages of South America
sources.notes: Highlights hotspots for phoneme diversity in Amazonian and Andean regions.

sources.title: Languages of Asia
sources.notes: Frames coverage for South, Southeast, East, and Central Asian phoneme templates.

sources.title: East Asian languages
sources.notes: Focuses on Sino-Tibetan, Japonic, Koreanic, and neighboring families for tonal and pitch-accent modelling.

sources.title: Languages of South Asia
sources.notes: Highlights Indo-Aryan and Dravidian interplay for phoneme contour planning.

sources.title: Classification of Southeast Asian languages
sources.notes: Summarises Mainland vs Maritime Southeast Asian typologies for voice presets.

sources.title: Languages of Europe
sources.notes: Coordinates coverage of Indo-European, Uralic, and minority languages for European NVDA builds.

sources.title: Languages of Russia
sources.notes: Critical for covering Russia's diverse linguistic landscape and script usage.

sources.title: Languages of Oceania
sources.notes: Combines Austronesian and Papuan coverage needs for Pacific voice bundles.

sources.title: List of languages by time of extinction
sources.notes: Useful for planning archival voice packs and resurrected phoneme datasets.

sources.title: Lists of endangered languages
sources.notes: Prioritises languages that need urgent preservation in Eloquence.

sources.title: List of revived languages
sources.notes: Shows where community documentation already exists to seed phoneme templates.

sources.title: Regional language
sources.notes: Helps align NVDA packaging with legal definitions of regional languages.

sources.title: List of lingua francas
sources.notes: Identifies languages needing robust accent coverage for cross-community communication.

sources.title: International English
sources.notes: Supports NVDA's global English presets spanning neutral accent strategies.

sources.title: List of official languages
sources.notes: Companion dataset to country/territory lists for packaging planning.

sources.title: List of official languages of international organizations
sources.notes: Helps prioritise languages critical for NGO and intergovernmental accessibility.

sources.title: Languages used on the Internet
sources.notes: Supports planning for online text-to-speech coverage and phoneme bias corrections.

sources.title: Mutual intelligibility
sources.notes: Guides accent slider defaults and cross-dialect bundling for Eloquence.

sources.title: List of creole languages
sources.notes: Documents lexifier/substrate relationships vital for phoneme blending parameters.

sources.title: Mixed language examples
sources.notes: Supports modelling of blended phoneme sets and accent transitions.

sources.title: Indo-European based pidgins, creoles, mixed languages, and cants
sources.notes: Gives actionable lists for English/French/Spanish-based derivatives relevant to NVDA.

sources.title: List of English-based pidgins
sources.notes: Focuses English derivative coverage for accent slider presets.

sources.title: List of sign languages
sources.notes: Supports planning for signed language phoneme proxies and iconography integration.

sources.title: List of sign languages by number of native signers
sources.notes: Prioritises sign languages by community size for gesture-to-phoneme mapping.

sources.title: Category: Dialects by language
sources.notes: Helps automate discovery of per-language dialect pages for accent slider presets.

sources.title: List of writing systems
sources.notes: Enables crosswalk between scripts and NVDA phoneme templates.

sources.title: List of shorthand systems
sources.notes: Relevant for high-speed phoneme articulation and stenography-friendly presets.

sources.title: Category: Lists of computer languages
sources.notes: Broader index for programming and markup language pronunciation packs.

sources.title: Lists of programming languages
sources.notes: Ensures coverage for domain-specific languages and education-focused pronunciations.

sources.title: Ontology language classification
sources.notes: Supports knowledge graph integration and speech output for ontology editors.

sources.title: Modelling language types
sources.notes: Aligns phoneme articulation for UML, SysML, and related modelling vocabularies.

sources.title: List of markup languages
sources.notes: Captures HTML/XML variants for developer voice presets.

sources.title: Inuktitut language
sources.notes: Feeds ISO iu roadmap work with syllabics charts, mora timing research, and punctuation guidance for right-to-left syllable clusters.

sources.title: Cherokee language
sources.notes: Supports ISO chr pronunciation templates and DECtalk lexicon comparisons prior to NVDA braille export updates.

sources.title: Cherokee syllabary
sources.notes: Documents syllable blocks for CodeQL validation and NVDA braille table integration when packaging Cherokee presets.

sources.title: Greenlandic language
sources.notes: Guides ISO kl (Kalaallisut) tone curves, affix stacking, and NVDA punctuation defaults sourced from NV Access manuals.

sources.title: Denaʼina language
sources.notes: Aligns ISO tfn Athabaskan presets with DataJake lexical archives and NV Speech Player nasal balance sliders.

sources.title: Gwich'in language
sources.notes: Supports ISO gwi slider planning with tone marker metadata for NVDA braille and phoneme EQ exports.

sources.title: Uyghur language
sources.notes: Highlights Arabic-script vowels and Latin transliteration tables for ISO ug dual-script packaging.

sources.title: Uzbek language
sources.notes: Documents dual-script policy and vowel harmony cues that feed ISO uz roadmap updates.

sources.title: Pashto language
sources.notes: Captures retroflex, aspirated, and fricative inventories for ISO ps pronunciation presets.

sources.title: Sindhi language
sources.notes: Provides implosive consonant coverage and braille mappings to support ISO sd roadmap work.

sources.title: Somali language
sources.notes: Supplies ATR vowel harmony references and tone plateau examples for ISO so voice planning.

sources.title: Fula language
sources.notes: Pulaar/Fulfulde ATR harmony, implosive consonants, and Ajami ↔ Latin rules align ISO `ff` dictionary imports with DataJake recitations, GitHub morphology tooling, and NVDA punctuation audits.

sources.title: Sinhala language
sources.notes: Details murmur, retroflex, and consonant length contrasts for ISO si phoneme datasets.

sources.title: Nepali language
sources.notes: Documents schwa deletion, retroflex series, and tone neutralisation heuristics for ISO ne roadmap entries.

sources.title: Kashmiri language
sources.notes: Tracks Perso-Arabic and Sharada orthography details to align ISO ks dual-script packaging.

sources.title: Omniglot
sources.notes: Secondary repository for script charts and pronunciation audio that can seed Eloquence phoneme datasets.

sources.title: Tigrinya language
sources.notes: Captures Ethiopic syllable structure for NVDA braille exports and informs DataJake lexicon extraction plus GitHub transliteration tooling.

sources.title: Afar language
sources.notes: Supports dual Ethiopic/Latin script planning when aligning DataJake `.dic` payloads with NVDA braille punctuation.

sources.title: Somali phonology
sources.notes: Feeds NV Speech Player Tone/Vocal range presets and validates DataJake hymn corpora before packaging.

sources.title: Malagasy language
sources.notes: Guides GitHub morphology scripts and NVDA hyphenation tables for Malagasy voice templates.

sources.title: Kirundi language
sources.notes: Aligns DataJake `.lex` payloads with NV Speech Player Inflection contour defaults and Bantu EQ presets.

sources.title: Sango language
sources.notes: Informs macro volume and Tone presets while confirming NVDA punctuation for French-derived digraphs.

sources.title: Tswana language
sources.notes: Supports DataJake archive mapping and NVDA braille validation for Setswana coverage.

sources.title: Tsonga language
sources.notes: Aligns DataJake recordings with NV Speech Player EQ calibration for Tsonga voices.

sources.title: Dhivehi language
sources.notes: Thaana right-to-left diacritics guide NVDA braille exports and offline packaging for ISO dv; paired with DataJake Qur’anic pronunciation lexicons and GitHub transliteration tooling.

sources.title: Thaana
sources.notes: Captures Thaana vowel/consonant markers, Arabic borrowings, and numeral handling so dual Thaana/Latin presets stay aligned with CodeQL-audited transliteration helpers.

sources.title: Lao language
sources.notes: Tone contour charts and vowel length metadata feed NV Speech Player Tone size/Scope depth presets and DataJake sermon recordings for ISO lo.

sources.title: Welsh phonology
sources.notes: Lenition and eclipsis schedules align Celtic mutation presets, DECtalk dictionaries, and DataJake .dic inventories for ISO cy.

sources.title: Breton language
sources.notes: Stress placement and nasalisation cues inform NV Speech Player Nasal balance and Inflection contour sliders plus DataJake liturgical corpora for ISO br.

sources.title: Nuer language
sources.notes: ATR harmony, breathy vowels, and apostrophe tone markers connect DataJake scripture corpora with NVDA punctuation snapshots and NV Speech Player tone presets for ISO nus.

sources.title: Kabyle language
sources.notes: Kabyle consonant emphasis, vowel harmony, and Tifinagh ⇄ Latin transliteration cues steer ISO kab phoneme presets, NV Speech Player Plosive impact sliders, and NVDA braille exports.

sources.title: Central Atlas Tamazight
sources.notes: Central Atlas Tamazight orthography notes feed ISO tzm dual-script packaging, guiding CodeQL-audited profile seeding and NV Speech Player Tone/Plosive defaults.

sources.title: Bambara language
sources.notes: Bambara ATR harmony, nasal vowel, and tonal contour datasets align DataJake scripture recordings with NV Speech Player Nasal balance and Macro volume presets for ISO bm.

sources.title: Tok Pisin
sources.notes: Tok Pisin creole phonology and punctuation conventions inform DataJake/GitHub dictionary imports, NVDA manual alignment, and tone-neutral slider presets for ISO tpi.

sources.title: Fijian language
sources.notes: Fijian vowel length and prenasalised stop behaviour shape EQ envelopes and NV Speech Player Inflection contour presets for ISO fj using DataJake hymn recordings.

sources.title: Marshallese language
sources.notes: Marshallese voiceless vowel series and consonant allophones guide frequency presets and DataJake hymn ingestion for ISO mh.

sources.title: Lule Sami
sources.notes: Lule Sámi consonant gradation and vowel harmony references align GitHub finite-state analysers, DataJake lexical payloads, and NVDA braille exports for ISO smj.

sources.title: Yoruba language
sources.notes: Anchors ISO yo tonal planning with NV Speech Player Tone size/Scope depth presets, combining DataJake hymn lexicons and NVDA braille exports.

sources.title: Yoruba phonology
sources.notes: Captures downstep, ATR harmony, and vowel length cues for CodeQL-audited dictionary ingestion and tools/summarize_language_assets.py dashboards.

sources.title: Akan language
sources.notes: Guides Akan/Twi ISO ak tone planning with DataJake sermon corpora, GitHub morphological analysers, and NVDA apostrophe punctuation exports.

sources.title: Ewe language
sources.notes: Pairs DataJake hymn dictionaries with NV Speech Player Tone/Subtones presets and NVDA punctuation exports for ISO ee.

sources.title: Ga language
sources.notes: Supports ISO gaa nasal resonance presets by combining Wikipedia phonology, DataJake broadcast corpora, and NVDA braille punctuation snapshots.

sources.title: Luganda
sources.notes: Aligns Luganda (lg) dictionary staging with DataJake scripture payloads, GitHub morphological toolkits, and NVDA hyphenation tables.

sources.title: Lingala language
sources.notes: Ensures Lingala (ln) contour presets match DataJake scripture corpora while validating NVDA manual quotation marks and CodeQL packaging rules.

sources.title: Shona language
sources.notes: Feeds Shona (sn) EQ calibration and CodeQL-reviewed dictionary imports using DataJake phonology datasets and NV Speech Player contour presets.

sources.title: Cebuano language
sources.notes: Maps Visayan vowel harmony, glottal stops, and reduplication patterns that feed NV Speech Player **Tone size**/**Subtones** presets and CodeQL-audited dictionary imports from DataJake hymn corpora.

sources.title: Hiligaynon language
sources.notes: Documents stress placement and penultimate vowel length cues; paired with GitHub syllable tokenisers to seed NV Speech Player **Inflection contour** defaults.

sources.title: Ilocano language
sources.notes: Highlights glottal stop notation, vowel length, and enclitic placement for Ilocano; informs NVDA braille exports and tone slider defaults when merging DataJake radio corpora.

sources.title: Kapampangan language
sources.notes: Provides Austronesian stress inversion rules and Spanish loan orthography to validate Kapampangan `.dic` payloads and NVDA punctuation behaviour.

sources.title: Waray language
sources.notes: Covers Eastern Visayan stress, vowel alternations, and enclitic placement for Waray-Waray; used with DataJake scripture archives to calibrate NV Speech Player **Tone**/**Scope depth** sliders.

sources.title: Hmong language
sources.notes: Captures eight-level tone matrices and orthography variants (Romanised Popular Alphabet, Pahawh); anchors NV Speech Player **Tone**, **Scope depth**, and **Whisper** presets plus DataJake oral history corpora.

sources.title: Mizo language
sources.notes: Details Mizo tone registers, nasalisation, and orthography; pairs with GitHub tonal classifiers and DataJake hymn recordings for NV Speech Player **Tone**/**Nasal balance** planning.

sources.title: Haitian Creole
sources.notes: Cached Wikipedia nasal vowel and prosody tables steer ISO `ht` planning; DataJake hymn/radio `.dic` inventories, GitHub creole grammars, and NVDA braille exports align punctuation before CodeQL-reviewed dictionary imports.

sources.title: Jamaican Patois
sources.notes: Wikipedia basilect/acrolect references pair with DataJake narration corpora; GitHub transliteration helpers and NV Speech Player **Inflection contour** presets document creole vowel mergers for ISO `jam`.

sources.title: Garifuna language
sources.notes: Arawakan phonology resources and DataJake community radio lexicons guide ISO `cab` ejective plus nasal harmony coverage; NVDA braille exports confirm apostrophe tone markers before packaging.

sources.title: K'iche' language
sources.notes: Mayan phoneme tables connect to DataJake scripture corpora and GitHub grammars; NVDA braille snapshots validate saltillo handling ahead of ISO `quc` dictionary extraction.

sources.title: Papiamento
sources.notes: Wikipedia orthography and vowel merger notes align with DataJake tourism/training lexicons; GitHub transliteration utilities and NV Speech Player **Tone size** presets support ISO `pap` frequency planning alongside NVDA punctuation audits.

sources.title: Miskito language
sources.notes: Cached nasal stress studies plus DataJake scripture/news corpora inform ISO `miq` vowel timing; NVDA braille exports confirm accent placement before staging NV Speech Player **Scope depth** presets.

sources.title: Albanian language
sources.notes: Captures Gheg/Tosk stress and vowel reduction contrasts used to tune NV Speech Player **Sibilant clarity** presets before seeding ISO `sq` profiles.

sources.title: Bosnian language
sources.notes: Supports č/ć/đ preservation and ijekavian pitch-accent planning for ISO `bs`; feeds NV Speech Player **Inflection contour** tests.

sources.title: Croatian language
sources.notes: Aligns long/short rising/falling accent metadata with NV Speech Player **Inflection contour** defaults for ISO `hr`.

sources.title: Serbian language
sources.notes: Documents Cyrillic/Latin parity, palatalisation, and ijekavian/ekavian toggles so CodeQL-audited templates can ship dual-script ISO `sr` presets.

sources.title: Montenegrin language
sources.notes: Tracks ś/ź reforms and dual-accent proposals for ISO `cnr`; informs Montenegrin-specific EQ presets before packaging.

sources.title: Slovene language
sources.notes: Provides circumflex vs. acute mapping for ISO `sl` tone presets and NV Speech Player **Tone size** calibration.

sources.title: Macedonian language
sources.notes: Highlights schwa behaviour and voicing assimilation used to validate NVDA braille exports and dual-script fallbacks for ISO `mk`.

sources.title: Bislama language
sources.notes: Feeds ISO `bi` roadmap entries with loanword and phonotactic cues aligned to NVDA braille punctuation tests.

sources.title: Chamorro language
sources.notes: Documents glottal stop and reduplication behaviour so ISO `ch` profiles keep NV Speech Player tone presets and NVDA braille exports in sync.

sources.title: Palauan language
sources.notes: Aligns ISO `pau` tone and consonant harmony planning with NV Speech Player **Tone size**/**Vocal layers** presets.

sources.title: Niuean language
sources.notes: Confirms macron rendering and stress defaults for ISO `niu` packaging drills that follow the README no-release workflow.

sources.title: Tokelauan language
sources.notes: Guides NV Speech Player **Tone size**/**Subtones** presets and NVDA braille macron checks for ISO `tkl` entries.

sources.title: Rapa Nui language
sources.notes: Captures glottal stop timing and vowel length data so ISO `rap` voice presets map to the frequency matrix and offline packaging drill.

sources.title: Kyrgyz language
sources.notes: Documents vowel harmony, stress, and apostrophe digraph behaviour so ISO `ky` dual-script presets align with NVDA braille exports and CodeQL-audited transliteration helpers.

sources.title: Kazakh language
sources.notes: Captures vowel harmony tiers, ejective consonants, and script reform metadata that feed NV Speech Player **Tone**/**Macro volume** presets for ISO `kk`.

sources.title: Tajik language
sources.notes: Pairs Persian phonology with Tajik Cyrillic orthography; guides CodeQL-reviewed transliteration helpers and NV Speech Player preset validation before packaging ISO `tg`.

sources.title: Bashkir language
sources.notes: Highlights velarised consonants, vowel harmony, and diacritics so Bashkir (`ba`) EQ presets mirror Central Eurasian corpora and NVDA braille exports.

sources.title: Chuvash language
sources.notes: Details vowel harmony deviations and palatalisation cues so ISO `cv` dictionary imports align with NV Speech Player **Sibilant clarity** presets and CodeQL policies.

sources.title: Sakha language
sources.notes: Provides throat-singing timbre, vowel harmony, and consonant length metadata so ISO `sah` presets map NV Speech Player **Tone size**/**Scope depth** sliders to Central Eurasian recordings.

sources.title: Udmurt language
sources.notes: Supplies consonant harmony, vowel reduction, and orthography cues so ISO `udm` packaging aligns DataJake corpora with NVDA braille exports and NV Speech Player slider defaults.

sources.title: Basque language
sample_assets: Wikipedia ergativity and sibilant harmony notes
sources.notes: Pairs ergative-absolutive structure, sibilant harmony, and stress data with DataJake corpora so NV Speech Player **Inflection contour**/**Sibilant clarity** presets align before CodeQL dictionary imports for ISO `eu`.

sources.title: Occitan language
sources.notes: Captures nasal balance, schwa reduction, and accent placement so ISO `oc` presets align NV Speech Player **Nasal balance** sliders with NVDA punctuation tests and DataJake recordings.

sources.title: Romansh language
sources.notes: Documents `tg`, `gl`, and `sc` digraph handling so ISO `rm` profiles sync Eloquence phonemes, NVDA braille contractions, and NV Speech Player **Tone size**/**Inflection contour** presets.

sources.title: Friulian language
sources.notes: Captures alveolar affricates, vowel length, and orthography variants to stage Friulian (`fur`) dictionaries with NV Speech Player **Tone size** calibration.

sources.title: Sardinian language
sources.notes: Provides vowel centralisation and consonant contrast metadata so ISO `sc` presets tune NV Speech Player **Macro volume**/**Subtones** sliders before CodeQL dictionary review.

sources.title: Corsican language
sources.notes: Highlights vowel reduction, syllable timing, and accent placement so ISO `co` voices validate NV Speech Player **Vocal range** presets with NVDA braille accent handling.

sources.title: Luxembourgish language
sources.notes: Documents digraphs, stress, and schwa behaviour so ISO `lb` presets align NV Speech Player **Stress**/**Sibilant clarity** sliders with NVDA hyphenation exports.

sources.title: West Frisian language
sources.notes: Tracks vowel harmony, diphthongs, and voiced fricatives so ISO `fy` voices share NV Speech Player **Stress**/**Sibilant clarity** presets with NVDA braille guidance.

sources.title: Asturian language
sources.notes: Provides nasal vowel and palatal lateral cues so ISO `ast` presets tune NV Speech Player **Inflection contour** and braille contractions before packaging.

sources.title: Walloon language
sources.notes: Details Walloon diphthongs, nasal vowels, and orthography updates so ISO `wa` presets align NV Speech Player **Nasal balance**/**Tone size** sliders with NVDA braille exports.

sources.title: Ainu language
sources.notes: Documents Katakana and Latin transcription, tone, and consonant inventories so ISO `ain` presets align NV Speech Player contour sliders while CodeQL monitors dictionary imports staged from cached DataJake corpora.

sources.title: Aleut language
sources.notes: Captures Cyrillic and Latin Aleut spellings plus glottal stop cues so ISO `ale` presets bundle DataJake lexicons, GitHub converters, and NVDA braille audits before CodeQL-gated packaging.

sources.title: Chukchi language
sources.notes: Provides polysynthetic templates, ejective consonants, and vowel harmony data so ISO `ckt` voices mirror Siberian corpora and NV Speech Player contour presets while CodeQL verifies archive provenance.

sources.title: Nivkh language
sources.notes: Orthography and ejective consonant research keeps ISO `niv` profiles aligned with dual-script needs while DataJake corpora and NVDA braille audits confirm apostrophe handling for offline builds.

sources.title: Khanty language
sources.notes: Highlights gradation, vowel harmony, and dialect splits so ISO `kca` presets blend DataJake recordings with GitHub tooling and NVDA braille checks prior to CodeQL-reviewed dictionary ingestion.

sources.title: Mansi language
sources.notes: Extends Khanty gradation research for ISO `mns`, guiding NV Speech Player **Tone size**/**Subtones** presets while NVDA braille exports confirm diacritic placement in offline builds.

sources.title: Komi-Zyrian language
sources.notes: Captures palatalisation, ergativity, and diacritic usage so ISO `kpv` voice and dictionary updates align DataJake assets with GitHub analysers and NVDA braille behaviour under CodeQL supervision.

sources.title: Komi-Permyak language
sources.notes: Documents vowel harmony deviations and consonant palatalisation so ISO `koi` presets mirror DataJake corpora and GitHub converters while NVDA braille exports confirm diacritic coverage.

sources.title: Meadow Mari language
